'''Kamal Abbas''' is General Coordinator of the [[Center for Trade Unions and Workers Services]] (CTUWS), an activist group for independent unions in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dine |first=Philip |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/feb/8/dine-egyptian-workers-key-element-in-uprising/ |title=DINE: Egyptian workers key element in uprising |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-02-08 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Involved in activism for over 20 years<ref name="towardfreedom1">{{cite web|url=http://www.towardfreedom.com/home/labor/2439-roots-of-egypts-revolution-labor-unions-and-the-uprising-in-tahrir-square |title=Roots of Egyptâs Revolution: Labor Unions and the Uprising in Tahrir Square |publisher=Towardfreedom.com |date=2011-06-22 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Abbas has been active in mobilizing worker support during the [[Egyptian revolution of 2011]] and its aftermath. His approach emphasizes peaceful strikes and rallies accompanied by demands for better wages and working conditions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011216141815340645.html |title=Egyptians defy call to end strikes - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
'''Kamal Abbas''' is General Coordinator of the [[Center for Trade Unions and Workers Services]] (CTUWS), an activist group for independent unions in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dine |first=Philip |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/feb/8/dine-egyptian-workers-key-element-in-uprising/ |title=DINE: Egyptian workers key element in uprising |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-02-08 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Involved in activism for over 20 years<ref name="towardfreedom1">{{cite web|url=http://www.towardfreedom.com/home/labor/2439-roots-of-egypts-revolution-labor-unions-and-the-uprising-in-tahrir-square |title=Roots of Egyptâs Revolution: Labor Unions and the Uprising in Tahrir Square |publisher=Towardfreedom.com |date=2011-06-22 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Abbas has been active in mobilizing worker support during the [[Egyptian revolution of 2011]] and its aftermath. His approach emphasizes peaceful strikes and rallies accompanied by demands for better wages and working conditions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011216141815340645.html |title=Egyptians defy call to end strikes - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
Line 10: Line 33:
During the 2011 revolution Abbas made a video from [[Tahrir Square]] telling American workers: <blockquote>"From this place, I want you to know that we stand with you as you stood with us. I want you to know that no power can challenge the will of the people when they believe in their rights. When they raise their voices loud and clear and struggle against exploitation.No one believed that our revolution could succeed against the strongest dictatorship in the region. But in 18 days the revolution achieved the victory of the peopleâ¦.We want you to know that we stand on your side. Stand firm and donât waiver. Donât give up on your rights. Victory always belongs to the people who stand firm and demand their just rights. We and all the people of the world stand on your side and give you our full support. As our just struggle for freedom, democracy and justice succeeded, your struggle will succeed. Victory belongs to you when you stand firm and remain steadfast in demahttp://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kamal_Abbas&action=edit&redlink=1nding your just rights."<ref>{{cite web|author=Mark Levine |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/opinion/2011/02/201122518445333563.html |title=History's shifting sands - Opinion |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-26 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Parks |first=James |url=http://blog.aflcio.org/tag/kamal-abbas/ |title=Kamal Abbas | AFL-CIO NOW BLOG |publisher=Blog.aflcio.org |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.michaelmoore.com/words/must-read/statement-kamal-abbas |title='We Stand With You as You Stood With Us': Statement to Workers of Wisconsin by Kamal Abbas of Egypt's Centre for Trade Unions and Workers Services |publisher=MichaelMoore.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref></blockquote>
During the 2011 revolution Abbas made a video from [[Tahrir Square]] telling American workers: <blockquote>"From this place, I want you to know that we stand with you as you stood with us. I want you to know that no power can challenge the will of the people when they believe in their rights. When they raise their voices loud and clear and struggle against exploitation.No one believed that our revolution could succeed against the strongest dictatorship in the region. But in 18 days the revolution achieved the victory of the peopleâ¦.We want you to know that we stand on your side. Stand firm and donât waiver. Donât give up on your rights. Victory always belongs to the people who stand firm and demand their just rights. We and all the people of the world stand on your side and give you our full support. As our just struggle for freedom, democracy and justice succeeded, your struggle will succeed. Victory belongs to you when you stand firm and remain steadfast in demahttp://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kamal_Abbas&action=edit&redlink=1nding your just rights."<ref>{{cite web|author=Mark Levine |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/opinion/2011/02/201122518445333563.html |title=History's shifting sands - Opinion |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-26 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Parks |first=James |url=http://blog.aflcio.org/tag/kamal-abbas/ |title=Kamal Abbas | AFL-CIO NOW BLOG |publisher=Blog.aflcio.org |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.michaelmoore.com/words/must-read/statement-kamal-abbas |title='We Stand With You as You Stood With Us': Statement to Workers of Wisconsin by Kamal Abbas of Egypt's Centre for Trade Unions and Workers Services |publisher=MichaelMoore.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref></blockquote>
